Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different habitats, one on land (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can illustrate and label different types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can use their drawings to compare and show the differences in the types of living things that can be found in each habitat.
The student can identify and describe patterns they observe about plant and animal diversity across the two different habitats in their drawings.
